title: GREEN Meghalaya Plus: Meghalaya Chief Minister Launches GREEN Meghalaya Plus Scheme to Boost Forest Conservation | Shillong News - Times of India
text: Shillong: Chief minister Conrad K Sangma on Wednesday launched the GREEN Meghalaya plus scheme at Tura in West Garo Hills district as part of the state govt’s initiative — Payment for Eco System Services (PES). The scheme will provide an incentive of up to Rs 20,000 per hectare per year to communities and individuals for the conservation of forest cover.Green Meghalaya Plus aims to include an additional 50,000 hectares (500 sq km) of forest cover under conservation. In the past, over 3000 individuals or communities benefited from the scheme and conserved more than 54,000 hectares of natural forest.“In the last seven years, govt has laid the foundation and initiated programmes that have benefited our people and accelerated growth and development. There is a huge turnaround in the size of our economy today. As a govt, we are taking advantage of different funds from the state, centre and other external agencies for the growth of our state,” the CM said.We also published the following articles recently27,000 hectares pasture land freed from encroachmentIn 12 districts, Uttar Pradesh's revenue department freed over 27,000 hectares of pasture land from illegal encroachment. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed a village-wise inventory of pastures and plans a large-scale campaign to reclaim remaining land.
